summary: Email chain from December 9, 2021, regarding the coordination of a DMV witness for a trial, likely related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The correspondence involves U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and a New York DMV official arranging for certified records and witness availability.

persons.name: William Brown
persons.context: DMV employee who will serve as a witness and provides certified driving records and photos for a trial.

persons.name: Janis Echenberg
persons.context: U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutor coordinating with the DMV to secure a witness for trial.

persons.name: Thomas McKay
persons.context: U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutor copied on the email chain regarding DMV witness coordination.

connections.description: Prosecutor coordinating with DMV official to arrange for trial witness and certified records.
Both are prosecutors with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, collaborating on trial preparation.

events.title: Trial adjournment and witness coordination
events.description: Trial adjourned for the day but may resume tomorrow; U.S. Attorney's Office coordinates with DMV to have a witness on standby.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On December 9, 2021, a trial (likely Ghislaine Maxwell's) was adjourned but potentially resuming the next day.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively coordinating with the NY DMV to secure a witness and certified driving records.
DMV official William Brown agreed to be the witness and had certified records ready, indicating official documentation was being introduced as evidence.
The email chain is marked as subject to a protective order, indicating sensitive or restricted information related to the case.
The correspondence shows procedural trial preparation activities by federal prosecutors.
